content.question: Using the model of speciation and applying it to a different population, which of the following outcomes is most consistent for a different species in which the males are homogametic and the females are heterogametic?

choices.label: Sterility would appear in females before appearing in males.
Speciation would occur more rapidly because females would produce more offspring.
Behavioral isolation would occur sooner in species exhibiting nonrandom mating.
The population would reach Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium at an accelerated rate.

content.answer: Sterility would appear in females before appearing in males.
